content.description: This climb is awaiting a FA. Its prob a 13? in the beggining. There is 4 fixed draws with the crux at the top fixed draw. The rest of the climb is 11ish and spicy.
content.location: This is the far left route on the belay ledge. Approached by climbing Totally Unacceptable. There is a set of long chains connected to three bolts to the left of the climb so that you may belay out of the way and in a comforatable stance on a ledge.

content.description: A dihedral-ish gully slab that's harder than it looks, polished and slick, crux around bolt 3 or 4 is a blank section with bad hands and glossy feet... top section full of sand and gravel... as always with birdsboro, PLEASE wear a helmet as a belayer!!!
content.protection: 6 or 7 Bolts plus 2 chains at anchor

content.description: This climb is the approach to the belay ledge for all the great climbs at the Wall of Immortals area. It changes frequently due to chossy conditions.
This climbs crux is the blank crumbley start. Then it is an enjoyable 5.7. The easiest route on The Wall of Immortals, and a stright shot into Blankety Blank!
content.location: This climb is located at the Wall of Immortals and is the far right of the first pitch climbs. It's first two anchors are shared with Eight.Nine.Ten.

content.description: This is a endurance climb. With drilled pockets where needed. Some thin dirty climbing into a obvious roof that you climb out of the left side, crux. And some reachy moves continue to another smaller roof that you move left on as well. Pumpy to the finish.
content.location: Birdsboro, Wall of the Immortals. The start is located at the top of the approach route totally unacceptable. And is is the middle route on the ledge. There is one line to the left with fixed draws at the start that climb is Uncharted territory.

content.description: This climb is 5.11 right away awesome rock leads to harder climbing crux is gaining and pulling first roof.
content.location: Far right line on wall of immortals. Is a second pitch climb. Easily accessible from the fixed cable traverse, from the ground up wall. Climb either get wet or nobama and then move left on cable.

content.description: This climb pulls through the stacked roofs and then angles up and left to finish.Havnt tried it yet just bolted it not sure of grade or crux! I will post more info when I try it.Or it gets Sent
content.location: A third pitch climb to the right of Magnanimous and to the left of Afternoon Delight

content.description: the obvious bolted hanging arete visible from the lower slabs to the big wall. a well protected burl fest. pretty easy moves off the ledge to the first 2 or 3 bolts. Once you clip the first chain your in the buisness, keep moving and try not to get crossed up. big dynamic moves on drilled pockets. Not a lot of footholds so don't bother looking. crux is pulling over the belly. 5.11 moves to the top
content.protection: All fixed draws except for the first 3 bolts. bring an extra quick draw or two as some of the biners tend to flip the wrong way in the chain and is a real pain to fix on lead. This is Birdsboro so follow the obvious holds and try your best to stay on route. Holds have been coming off pretty regularly and will do so until it sees more traffic.
content.location: get on the trail for the great wall and walk towards the wall staying next to the water. start up Totally Unacceptable (5.8/9) belay at the ledge and start up Poised For Peril (5.11+) clipping every bolt along the way to keep the rope out of your way (you'll see what I mean). At the last roof, just shy of the Poised anchors cut right and follow the bolts for an airy traverse to the steel cable and build an anchor where ever you see fit. Then the money pitch. If you make it to the top there is a chance you wont be able to get back into the wall when you lower. Have your belayer lower you to the slab beneath the cable, but not under the roof. have them toss you a bight of rope (lets hope theyre using a grigri) and pull yourself back in. rap from the rap anchors on the left side of the ledge. 60 meter rope will get you to the ground.

content.description: New route starts with a left facing flake pulls small roofs and tops out at Magnanimous's belay ledge
content.location: Climb Eight Nine Ten or, Son of a Blankety Blank to gain access to this route.

content.description: This climb is a sloping low angle left facing diehdral. The start shares the first two bolts with Son of a Blankety Blank. And the finish shares the last bolt and top anchors with Totally Unacceptable. But can also be finished to the right on Son of a Blankety Blank's finish. I enjoyed this climb very much.
content.location: This is a first pitch climb located at the Wall of Immortals directly to the right of Totally Unacceptable.

content.description: This route starts with some easy 5.10 climbing past 3 bolts up to a small roof. Pulling through the roof is not obvious and feels around V6; and clipping the 4th bolt is very strenuous. Once established above the roof about 20 feet of technical 5.10 climbing in a fun dihedral guards the chains.
content.location: This is the far right route on the belay ledge and shortest line. Also gives direct access to the third pitch ledge and Magnanimous.

content.description: Climb up a short slab to a roof, bust out right and up. this is the crux. make your way up onto the slab to the anchors. strenuous fun climb.
content.location: furtherest climb left on the ground level of the magnanimous wall

content.description: New route very thin start possible crux, straight shot to the bottom of a roof then curves out roof.
content.location: Climb Eight Nine Ten or Son of a Blankety Blank to gain access to this route.

content.description: Fun short route. To start you step right of a huge ledge onto tiny feet nice exposure.
content.location: This is a third pitch climb located to the right of Magnanimous you could miss it entirely if you dont go to the end of the fixed line and peer around the corner to see the start. Nice warm up.

content.description: The Wall of Immortals is the big, dramatic looking wall on the left-hand side of the water. Mortals need not apply.
